message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The normal laboratory studies suggest that the patient does not have vitamin B12 deficiency, thyroid problems, or autoimmune encephalitis. Increased 14-3-3 protein concentration in the CSF is associated with Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease, a rare neurodegenerative disorder. Antiganglioside GM1 antibodies are associated with Guillain-Barre syndrome, increased α-synuclein protein concentration is associated with Parkinson's disease, and anti-glutamic acid decarboxylase antibodies are associated with autoimmune encephalitis.
